title: 113_hr1601
content: The "Supplemental Security Income Restoration Act of 2013" updates eligibility for the Supplemental Security Income program. The "Supplemental Security Income Restoration Act of 2013" updates eligibility criteria for the Supplemental Security Income program, including increases in income and resource limits for individuals and couples. The "Supplemental Security Income Restoration Act of 2013" updates eligibility criteria for the Supplemental Security Income program, including increases in income and resource limits for individuals and couples. Section 1617 of the Act is amended to include an inflation adjustment for specified amounts in subsequent calendar years. The "Supplemental Security Income Restoration Act of 2013" updates eligibility criteria for the Supplemental Security Income program, including increases in income and resource limits for individuals and couples. Section 1617 of the Act is amended to include an inflation adjustment based on the Consumer Price Index for Urban Wage Earners and Clerical Workers for the 12-month period ending with September of the preceding calendar year. The "Support and Maintenance Furnished in Kind Not Included as Income" provision is part of the Supplemental Security Income Restoration Act of 2013, which updates eligibility criteria for the program. The Supplemental Security Income Restoration Act of 2013 amends Section 1612(a)(2) of the Act to exclude support or maintenance furnished in kind as income. Conforming amendments are made to Section 1611(c) and Section 1612(a)(2) of the Act. Section 1612(a)(2) of the Act is amended to exclude support or maintenance furnished in cash to an alien by their sponsor within 5 years of entry into the United States. Support or maintenance provided in cash to an alien by their sponsor within 5 years of entry into the United States shall not be considered as income for the alien under section 1612(a)(2)(A). SEC. 4. REPEAL OF PENALTY FOR DISPOSAL OF RESOURCES FOR LESS THAN FAIR MARKET VALUE. Section 1613(c) of the Act is amended to notify individuals applying for benefits about Medicaid policy restricting eligibility based on disposal of resources for less than fair market value. The Commissioner of Social Security will provide information to State agencies administering Medicaid plans to determine if a period of ineligibility for benefits is required under section 1917(c). The amendments made by this Act will be effective on January 1, 2015.
